revision.comment: #* '''2011''', Craig Groeschel, ''Love, Sex, and Happily Ever After'' (page 13) #*: I drew the deepest, '''yawniest''' breath I could fake and swiftly lifted my right arm.
revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|en|yawn|y}} ===Adjective=== {{en-adj|er}} # Prone to [[yawn]]ing. #* '''1848''', {{w|Orson Squire Fowler}}, ''A Home for All'' #*: Waking up in the small room, you feel dull, stupid, gloomy, oppressed, '''yawny''', lax, and all unstrung in body and mind... # Sounding like a [[yawn]]. #* '''2011''', Craig Groeschel, ''Love, Sex, and Happily Ever After'' (page 13) #*: I drew the deepest, '''yawniest''' breath I could fake and swiftly lifted my right arm. # [[boring|Boring]], [[uninteresting]], causing [[yawn]]s.
